content:
HttpModuleActionCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of HttpModuleAction objects. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[System.Configuration.ConfigurationCollection(typeof(System.Web.Configuration.HttpModuleAction))]
public sealed class HttpModuleActionCollection : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Remarks

The HttpModuleActionCollection collection allows access to the HttpModuleAction elements of the HttpModulesSection section.

Constructors

HttpModuleActionCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the HttpModuleActionCollection class.

public HttpModuleActionCollection ();

Remarks

This constructor creates a non-initialized instance of the HttpModuleActionCollection object.

Properties

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets an item in this collection.

public System.Web.Configuration.HttpModuleAction this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

Module collection index.

Value
HttpModuleAction

The item at the specified index.

Remarks

This property is intended for internal use only.

protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }
Value
ConfigurationPropertyCollection

To be added.

Methods

Add(HttpModuleAction)

Adds an HttpModuleAction object to the collection.

public void Add (System.Web.Configuration.HttpModuleAction httpModule);
httpModule
HttpModuleAction

The HttpModuleAction module to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

An attempt was made to add an HttpModuleAction object that already exists in the collection.

Remarks

Adds an HttpModuleAction object to the collection.

Clear()

Removes all HttpModuleAction objects from the collection.

public void Clear ();

Remarks

This method inserts a clear directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.

protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement CreateNewElement ();
Returns

To be added.

Returns
Object

To be added.

IndexOf(HttpModuleAction)

Gets the collection index of the specified HttpModuleAction module.

public int IndexOf (System.Web.Configuration.HttpModuleAction action);
action
HttpModuleAction

The HttpModuleAction module for which to get the collection index.

Returns
Int32

The collection index value for the specified module.

Remarks

Before using this method, you must identify an HttpModuleAction module with the proper name and type. You can then use this module object to get its collection index.

IsElementRemovable(ConfigurationElement) 

protected override bool IsElementRemovable (System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement element);
element
ConfigurationElement

To be added.

Returns
Boolean

To be added.

Remove(String)

Removes an HttpModuleAction object from the collection.

public void Remove (string name);
name
String

The key that identifies the HttpModuleAction object to remove from the collection.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

There is no HttpModuleAction object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

Remarks

This method inserts a <remove> element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

Remove(HttpModuleAction)

Removes an HttpModuleAction object from the collection.

public void Remove (System.Web.Configuration.HttpModuleAction action);
action
HttpModuleAction

The HttpModuleAction module to remove.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

The passed HttpModuleAction object does not exist in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

Remarks

This method inserts a <remove> element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an HttpModuleAction module at the specified index from the collection.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index of the HttpModuleAction module to remove.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

There is no HttpModuleAction object at the specified index in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

Remarks

This method inserts a <remove> element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
